data.title: Voices of LGBTI: Louise Aksglæde, Elias Vargas and Ciara Dowling
data.meta_description: June is Pride Month, a tribute to the participants of the 1970 Stonewall Uprising in New York City and a recognition of the impact that lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex people have had on local, national and international history. By highlighting the personal journeys of some of our LGBTI colleagues, we aim not only to raise awareness about LGBTI issues, but also to give them a voice. We stand with them.
data.text:
Setting new standards at the world’s largest lake-based offshore wind power plant

Setting new standards at the world’s largest lake-based offshore wind power plant

Each offshore project is unique due to its enormous size and technical complexity; the Windpark Fryslân offshore wind power plant combines a multitude of features that make it even more special.

Read More

Journal

Voices of LGBTI: Hamzah Ziadeh and Katrin Kilders

Voices of LGBTI: Hamzah Ziadeh and Katrin Kilders

June is Pride Month, a tribute to the participants of the 1970 Stonewall Uprising in New York City and a recognition of the impact that lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex people have had on local, national and international history. By highlighting the personal journeys of some of our LGBTI colleagues, we aim not only to raise awareness about LGBTI issues, but also to give them a voice. We stand with them.

Read More

Journal

The future of the planet is decided in ten years

The future of the planet is decided in ten years

In these environments, there are a series of relationships between species inhabiting each placeand the environment in which they live, whether they belong to the same family or not. Without these interrelationships, the existence of different life forms on this planet would not exist; that is to say, one species cannot live without relating to another or its environment, therefore, there must always be a balance.
